name: Seared Veggie Rollups
author: SCOTTC
summary: Delightfully spicy finger food. It's a great appetizer for parties. I actually won a chili pepper cooking contest with this. A food processor is useful for chopping the peppers, onion and garlic. For the frozen mixed vegetables, I prefer a bag containing corn, beans and red peppers. Bon appetit!
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) can refrigerated crescent roll dough
directions: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook and stir jalapeno peppers, banana peppers, Anaheim pepper, garlic and onion in oil until soft, about 3 minutes
Mix in the frozen mixed vegetables, water, vegetable broth, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce
Raise heat to high and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until thick and darkened, 10 to 15 minutes
Preheat oven to 375  degrees F (190 degrees C)
Separate crescent roll dough into triangles, and arrange on a large baking sheet
Place a generous amount of the vegetable mixture on each triangle
Bake in the preheated oven 20 minutes, or until lightly browned
